intro: Harmsiopanax harmsii, commonly known as the Malay mountain ginseng, is a rare climbing plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant is notable for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in local remedies for its purported health benefits. Its conservation status is threatened due to habitat loss and overharvesting. Botanically, it exhibits a unique growth pattern with aerial roots and a woody stem.
